issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://copilot.microsoft.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fcopilot.microsoft.com%2F) ### Comment > 在Mac上無法使用Copilot > 但是在Windows 11、iPhone 15 pro（iOS 17.4.1）、iPad（iPadOS 17.4.1）使用皆正常，甚至啟用了DNS與更多的過濾器 > 唯一能夠正常使用Copilot的方式是禁用或是移除AdGuard > ------ > On Mac, Copilot cannot be used. > However, it works fine on Windows 11, iPhone 15 Pro (iOS 17.4.1), and iPad (iPadOS 17.4.1), even with DNS and additional filters enabled. > The only way to use Copilot successfully is to disable or remove AdGuard. Username: `@Paxi` ### Screenshots

comment.body:
Copilot: I use the web (Safari), not the app

To use Copilot, simply open the web page and start using it. There are no other steps required.

I have recorded a video demonstrating how Copilot worked normally until I installed AdGuard and then stopped working.
I
 have also included screenshots of the AdGuard logs.

Please refer to the attached video and screenshots.

https://screenshot.paxi.me/k0fwms1f
https://screenshot.paxi.me/q7GKzjML

sorry

I said too many things
I deleted everything, so no action is required on your part
end this matter

issue.title: www.twitch.tv

labels.name: Extra
labels.description: Issues, related to AdGuard Extra extension

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
This issue is known to be solved with [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra) userscript.

If you’re using AdGuard for Windows, Mac or Android, please make sure that AdGuard Extra is enabled in the application settings.

If you’re using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

issue.title: bing.com

labels.name: A: Bug
labels.description: The issue is caused by a program bug

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

labels.name: A: Waiting for data
labels.description: Waiting for more information from the user

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
 [http://bing.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fbing.com)
### Comment
> Using Adguard DNS default server with default ruleset makes the DNS resolution oscillating. A sniff with Wireshark outlined that bing.com gets resolved to CNAME records which end up being resolved in another CNAME records infinitely until timeout hits in. No resolution to A or AAA records possible.
Username: `@sarumaj`

### Screenshots
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 1</summary>

  ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/ih1iwp2x1oo4sookkk4wckco0kg48okmthzamf3y68.png?nc=1)
</details>
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled</summary>

  ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/obzz9lmf9yoow48ssw0kc0wgsk00k4ow1p2e178974.png?nc=1)
</details>

### System configuration

Information | Value
--- | ---
AdGuard product: | AdGuard DNS
DNS setup: | Device or router settings
DNS server: | AdGuard DNS Default server
System version: | Fritzbox 6660
Browser: | Edge

comment.body: Informed Devs. No filter issue though as it also happens with non-filtering DNS. No issue on Google DNS with local DNS filtering with AdGuard DNS blocking on Android.
